DataElement.preferredName: Concomitant Medication Antiplatelet Agent Receive Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator response regarding whether a patient is/has received medication that affects platelet function.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time._A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product._An agent that inhibits platelet aggregation and reduces coagulation in the circulatory system._To take, accept, or get something offered.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Concomitant; following as a consequence.:biologically active substance, including those intended for use in diagnosis, treatment, or prevention of disease or other abnormalities, for the relief of suffering, or control or improvement of a physical or mental state; includes biological products.

Concepts.definition: Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time.

A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.

Property.preferredDefinition: An agent that inhibits platelet aggregation and reduces coagulation in the circulatory system.:To take, accept, or get something offered.

Concepts.definition: An agent that inhibits platelet aggregation and reduces coagulation in the circulatory system.
To take, accept, or get something offered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is patient receiving any of t
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving any of the following concomitant medications during navitoclax administration:  Clopidogrel, ibuprofen, tirofiban, warfarin, and other anticoagulants, drugs, or herbal supplements that affect platelet function?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving anticoagulation or anti-platelet therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving any concurrent concomitant medications that affect platelet function due to mechanistic-based platelet toxicities from navitoclax: clopidogrel, ibuprofen, tirofiban and other anticoagulants, drugs or herbal supplements?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving more than or equal to 2 anti-thrombotic agents, including but not limited to anti-platelet agents (NSAIDs/aspirin, clopidogrel), heparin, LMWH, warfarin, and a direct thrombin inhibitor?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient require concurrent treatment with antithrombotic and/or anti-platelet agents (e.g., warfarin, heparin, low molecular weight heparin, aspirin, and/or ibuprofen)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient use antithrombotic and/or anti-platelet agents (e.g., warfarin, heparin, low molecular weight heparin, aspirin, and/or ibuprofen)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving greater than or equal to 2 anti-thrombotic agents, including but not limited to anti-platelet agents (NSAIDS/aspirin, clopidogrel), heparin, low molecular weight heparin, warfarin and a direct thrombin inhibitor?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient require concomitant treatment, in therapeutic doses, with anticoagulants such as warfarin or warfarin-related agents, heparin, thrombin or Factor Xa inhibitors, antiplatelet agents (e.g. clopidogrel) or new oral anticoagulants?  Low-dose aspirin (≤81 mg/day), low-dose warfarin (≤1 mg/day), and prophylactic low molecular weight heparin (LMWH) are permitted.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient require concomitant treatment, in therapeutic doses, with anticoagulants such as warfarin or warfarin-related agents, heparin, thrombin or Factor Xa inhibitors, antiplatelet agents (e.g. clopidogrel) or new oral anticoagulants?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving therapeutic-dose anticoagulation (e.g., warfarin, low-molecular weight heparin [LMWH], or novel oral anticoagulants)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient require oral or parenteral anticoagulants or thrombolytic agents for therapeutic purposes (including coumadin and warfarin), or has received such agents within 5 days or 5 elimination half-lives (whichever is shorter) of the first dose of M3814?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving concomitant anticoagulation with coumarin agents (e.g., warfarin), direct thrombin inhibitors (e.g., dabigatran), direct factor Xa inhibitor betrixaban, or platelet inhibitors (e.g., clopidogrel)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient require concomitant treatment with warfarin?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving any medications or substances that are Factor Xa inhibitors (i.e., rivaroxaban, apixaban, betrixaban, edoxaban otamixaban, letaxaban, eribaxaban) and Factor IIa inhibitors (i.e., dabigatran)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient taking oral Factor Xa inhibitors (i.e., rivaroxaban, apixaban, betrixaban, edoxaban otamixaban, letaxaban, eribaxaban) and Factor IIa inhibitors (i.e., dabigatran?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient require concomitant treatment, in therapeutic doses, with anticoagulants such as warfarin or warfarin-related agents, heparin, thrombin or Factor Xa inhibitors, or antiplatelet agents (e.g., clopidogrel)?
